list_definition.mean_english: bữa ăn muộn vào buổi tối
list_definition.definition: a meal taken at the end of the day

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She has invited me to supper.

list_ex_of_english: They all share the tasks of cooking, collecting funds, organizing ceremonial suppers, processions and the funerals of members according to religious precepts and unwritten statutory regulations.
I certainly do not diminish the hound trails, the puppy walking, the puppy shows, the dances—yes, there are dances—and the fund-raising suppers.
Fish fries, bean suppers, and pitch-in dinners alternated between the fire station and the churches.
He left out supper clubs—we do not have many of those either.
She wrote that some were so convicted that they left the room and threw up their suppers, and staggered back into the house as pale as death.
The atmosphere in these private quarters was so relaxed that the king was said to serve coffee during the suppers.
Following this old use, supper now is applied to the meal taken at the close of the day when the main meal, the dinner, is taken at midday.
As the sun was setting, and when most of the people were having their suppers, came the first shock.
